content.description:
This is an incredibly fun problem that links

Under Siege

into

Under The Sea

.

Do the first move or two of

Under Siege

, then bust left using underclings and crimps to link up with the mid section of

Under The Sea

.

The grade is a rough estimate, not something to be taken seriously or to measure one's self worth.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Under Siege

. It is 6 feet to the right of

Under The Sea

.

content.description:
SDS with your right hand in a good but sharp pocket and your left hand on basically nothing. Slap and squeeze your way up the perfectly rounded features to a mellow topout.

It is in the V6-V7 range, not V3+. It also happens to be one of the most classic problems in all of DGO....
content.protection: A crashpad. You swing out above a pretty nice ankle breaker for the dyno.
content.location:
Per

Erik Durgin

: Under The Sea climbs the blunt arete on the far left side of the northeast face of the Pocket Change Boulder. It is very easy to locate as it has a chest hight back-breaker boulder that sits 2 feet behind you as you're climbing.

content.description:
This has hard crimping up a gently overhanging face! Big stabs to small crimps and technical body positioning/footwork make this problem a really fun challenge.

SDS with a good left hand undercling/sidepull and a bad right hand sidepull crimp thing. Climb straight up the beautiful, black-streaked face on small crimps and underclings.

Again, the grade is nothing more than a suggestion. Try not to get your panties in a twist over it.
content.location:
This is on the far left side of the steep Northeast face of the Pocket Change Boulder 6 feet to the right of

Under The Sea

.

content.description:
Sit start on two pockets in the middle of the

Under the Sea

overhang, make big moves on big pockets up the overhanging face to a large pocket, and then mantel over the lip.

Sit start on right arete, work your way up, and top out the same as

Pocket Change

Direct Finish.

Start the same as

Pocket Change

, but at the third pocket, go straight up either by dynoing to the top or using a small intermediate pocket.
Sit start on far left pocket, and traverse right on pockets to a big move from the last pocket to the arete. Move around the arete to slabby terrain.
content.location: This is on the first vertical face you come to on the trail that spurs off the upper trail.

content.description: This is AKA Shorty Smalls. On the right side of the boulder, start low on two pockets. Go up and right to a pinchy thing and a crimp, and then make another move or two until you can mantel over the lip.
content.location: It is on the right side of the boulder.
